channel.title: Hosting
channel.description:
okay so heres my problem: I was able to host private servers for a long time and they all worked fine I had many players on my servers at all times. Then I got a laptop. So I had to get a new wireless router. So I thought to my self "Hey its not big deal ill just reportforward and the server should be back up" I was wrong -.-;; I have tried portforwarding and all that jazz but still I cannot have others connect to my private servers. Does anyone have any suggestions please! I will give you a hug :S I really wanna host my server again D=
Possible FAQ's Q: Did you portforward? A: Yes I did but it didnt work still Q: Do you have a no ip? A: Yes I do Q: Can you even get on the server? A: Yes I can but only when the ip is set to 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 or w.e If you can help thanks :D

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @limezo limezo
item.description:
@limezo wrote:

I dunno if this changes anything but I also have a desktop computer(what I used to use) and even it cannot host servers. OH! and one other thing when I turned on my laptop one time it said a computer on this connection also has the same ip then somthing else and it said press ok so I did. Would that have anything to do with it?

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @iamblackdemon iamblackdemon
item.description:
@iamblackdemon wrote:

yeah my connection ust went to wack 1 week later i cannot host a server again. i jsut reseted the router and followed my steps and i got it back running.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @Neon_Fortune Neon Fortune
item.description:
@Neon_Fortune wrote:

Not sure man but I know a lot of people who think they port forwarded but they didn’t do it correctly. This is probably the case.

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting
item.dc:creator: @iamblackdemon iamblackdemon
item.description:
@iamblackdemon wrote:

  1. try shutting off your firewall( not tring to hack you)
  2. its ether called port fowarding/gaming applications./Nat ->gaiming
  3. you have to port foward TCP Not UDP
    firewall->router->modem>

try canyouseeme.org
i just had this recently.

also
make sure your UPNP ,NAT, is enabled.

Read full topic

item.description:
@limezo wrote:

okay so heres my problem:
I was able to host private servers for a long time and they all worked fine I had many players on my servers at all times. Then I got a laptop. So I had to get a new wireless router. So I thought to my self “Hey its not big deal ill just reportforward and the server should be back up” I was wrong -.-;; I have tried portforwarding and all that jazz but still I cannot have others connect to my private servers.
